sentences.en: 'speak out, my boy -- don't be diffident.
sentences.cn: “ 说出来吧, 孩子 —— 别害怕.

sentences.en: Don't be so diffident about your talents.
sentences.cn: 别对自己的才能如此缺乏信心.

sentences.en: He has a politely diffident manner.
sentences.cn: 他的态度是客气中带有羞怯.

sentences.en: He is diffident about expressing his opinions in the public.
sentences.cn: 他在公开场合表达自己的意见感到胆怯.

sentences.en: He is diffident of his success.

sentences.cn: 他是那么冷淡,那么默默无声.

sentences.en: He was too diffident to do justice to himself.
sentences.cn: 他腼腆得使自己的表现不能恰如其分.

sentences.en: He was too diffident to express his opinion.
sentences.cn: 他太不自信，不敢发表自己的见解。

sentences.en: His fault is that he's too diffident.
sentences.cn: 他的过失是太缺乏自信啦.

sentences.en: I am fond of a diffident way which I see you to exhibit.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢您表现出来的谦卑.

sentences.en: I was diffident about [ of ] saying so.
sentences.cn: 我 不好意思 这么说.

sentences.en: In cool weather, serpents do not tempt; they grow diffident, recede and hibernate.
sentences.cn: 在凉爽的天气里, 蛇是不会出来引诱人的, 它会胆怯 、 退避,还要冬眠.

sentences.en: In the diffident manner was nothing of the art of the courtesan.
sentences.cn: 她羞怯的举止迥然不同于妓女的惺惺作态.

sentences.en: John was as bouncy and ebullient as Helen was diffident and reserved.
sentences.cn: 约翰活泼、热情；而海伦却羞怯、矜持。

sentences.en: She is diffident about expressing her opinions.
sentences.cn: 她怯于表述自己的意见.

sentences.en: While they speak softly, they are far from diffident.
sentences.cn: 他们的声音虽小, 却不含卑下.

words.tran_cn: 缺乏自信地；踌躇地；羞怯地

trans.tran_cn: 缺乏自信的，露出怯态的，羞怯的，踌躇的，虚
trans.tran_en: shy and not wanting to make people notice you or talk about you
